page.title: 14Housing
page.content: Houses in Rainford fall into a number of very separate categories.The original village followed the line of the main road to Ormskirk.Most of these houses have date stones which put their construction mainly in the nineteenth century. Rainford went through a rapid period of growth during the 1960's with the construction of the Old Hall Estate and the estate between Ormskirk Road and the brook.Rainford Junction also increased dramatically in size during this time. The majority of houses in Rainford are owner occupied although there are a number of council houses spread throghout the village.At the moment no further expansion of the village is possible without an upgrading of the sewage facilities.
